  • Files

Create a channel

  •  $ ach -C CHANNEL_NAME -n NOMINAL_MESSAGE_SIZE -m MESSAGE_COUNT

Remove a channel

  •  $ ach -U CHANNEL_NAME

Logging Channel Data

  •  $ achlog -d OUTPUT_DIRECTORY CHANNEL-1 CHANNEL-2 ... CHANNEL-N

Log files use the ach Pipe Protocol.

Remote Channels

  1. Ensure the the remote host has inetd running
  2. Ensure the the remote host's /etc/inetd.conf contains the line 
     8075                stream     tcp     nowait     nobody     /usr/bin/achpipe   /usr/bin/achpipe -R
  3. Ensure any channels exist on both the remote and local host
  4. Ensure that the remote channel is chmodded to 666 (or better yet, set up an ach user in inted.conf) 
     $ chmod /dev/shm/achshm-CHANNEL_NAME 666

Pull a Channel from a Remote Host

  •  $ achpipe -Wp CHANNEL_NAME -H REMOTE_HOST

Push a Channel to a Remote Host

  •  $ achpipe -Ws CHANNEL_NAME -H REMOTE_HOST
